p: For these reasons, Breynia species appear to be attracting candidates to be considered as significant source of secondary metabolites with health promoting or medicinal properties. Thus, B. retusa extracts were screened in terms of antioxidant and enzyme inhibitory activity. Three plant parts namely leaf, fruit and bark were evaluated using a battery of in vitro bioassays to assess its potential biological activity. Furthermore, detailed phytochemical profiles were obtained via chromatographic approach using HPLC-DAD-MS n analysis.
